title: 1–3. The brief accounts of Arthur and Charlemagne in the prologue to Godeffroy also function as “trailers” for the books recounting their deeds that Caxton published in 1485: 31 July for Le Morte d’Arthur, 1 December for Charles the Grete. Both prologues again place emphasis on the Nine Worthies and draw readers’ attention to Caxton’s previous publication of the life of Godfrey, and of Godfrey and Arthur, respectively. This serves to emphasise the common themes and improving function of the three works, but is also clearly a marketing strategy
